title: SmokerApeth
author: SmokerApeth
content: Tell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?Or do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?Or do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.My portfolio holds like 30% bitcoin and the rest are altcoins but major ones like top coins and some low cap medium projects that I think have potentials. These alts have been used for farming and staking so I guess its better to use them for long term earning through dividends or token rewards from staking and farming especially now that we are still on bear market season.

comments.author: klidex
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?Or do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.Yes, I am one of the many people who invest in Bitcoin and Ethereum I entrust long -term investment only in the two crypto assets.While I only use other altcoin as trading with a short time and seek faster profits and can be consistent in taking advantage.In the portfolio I invest Crypto in the long term 70% in Bitcoin and the rest I will enter in Ethereum because of the research and analysis that I have made Bitcoin and Ethereum is the most suitable and qualified asset to invest, moreover the two crypto are crypto assets which is ranked top.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?I mainly invest in Bitcoin.Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMOr do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I only have a few altcoins one of them is Ethereum, and the other one is BNB.Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMI usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.That's still a good composition but don't forget to have more allocation into bitcoin. It's the one that controls the market and is being followed by majority of the coins. So, if you've 70%-80% of Ethereum, I think you should put more to bitcoin unless you're focusing with ETH.

comments.author: siedemtrzy
comments.body: I mostly invest in Bitcoin, about 70% of my portfolio is Bitcoin. Then goes Ethereum with 15%. And the rest is a few altcoins.

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?Or do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.Yes, I invest my assets in bitcoin in a large amount compared to my altcoins because there are only a few altcoins that I still buy and keep until now while waiting for the price of each altcoin to increase again.If you focus on Ethereum, that's fine because each of us has our own preferences. This is about how we invest and choose coins based on the research we do. But you need to know that when it is about investment, you only need to invest with the money you can afford.

comments.author: SmokerApeth
comments.body: Do you think the current rise in Bitcoin and other altcoin is real? I think it's a fake.Let me know what you think.

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?Or do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum. 90% in bitcoin while the rest in ethereum and some altcoins. My interest in altcoins reduced in a few months when I first started because of their lack of transparency and easy bankruptcy in a bear market that hit newly launched altcoins hard.Hence I currently invest in bitcoin as much as possible. To me every other altcoin ends up being a liability and a source of loss.Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 10:44:06 AMDo you think the current rise in Bitcoin and other altcoin is real? I think it's a fake. Why dont you explain why you think it is "fake"? The data on aggregator sites is pooled from different exchanges and they would not all be lying about their stats for many days. They cant just fake that data and allow every site to put that up without making some news headlines in CoinTelegraph or so on.

comments.author: inthelongrun
comments.body: I think I am 50% to 60% invested in Bitcoin. About 20% is in Ethereum with the rest being in BNB and some smaller amounts on PIVX and other altcoins. I actually just purchased PIVX after I sold all my remaining AXS today which was up by 40%. Bitcoin and some altcoins might continue to grow bigger on my portfolio since I am not done purchasing them regularly. I buy Bitcoin monthly and then have my sights on Syscoin, Hedera, and some more BNBs.It would be easier to track especially on the ROI per coin if you just purchase coins with fixed amounts like $1,000, $100, or $200 rather than based it on percentage.

comments.author: TastyChillySauce00
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?I weren't mainly used bitcoin and ethereum as my asset. I would prefer to pick altcoins instead of those native coins. My reason is those coins were not giving huge returns in short time. I have bought aptos at $3 and yeah I make more than 4x in less than a month. That proves that if altcoin is even worthy compared with native coins. Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMOr do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?Yes, I do. Altcoins were always giving decent return for me. That's why I were always picked it. Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMI usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.How can you feel satisfied with return that given by ethereum? You can only make small returns with it.

comments.author: crzy
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?Or do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.I follow the basic rules on investing, which is not to put all your eggs in one basket.I have 50% invested with Bitcoin and the rest are equally divided with the top altcoins though I limit my holdings up to 5 good coins only so I can maximize its potential. If there's a way to participate with some Bounty, I'll grab that opportunity and take profit from it, I also practice reinvesting where I don't spend my profit because I believe it can be more worth it if I reinvest it.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?Or do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.If the deposit is small, then investing the bulk of the portfolio in heavy assets that are expensive and have already given thousands of percent is too questionable. In my opinion, the portfolio is better to assemble among a variety of projects, with an optimal distribution, so that there is diversification in case of various unforeseen situations. Creating a portfolio that will consist of 2-3 projects is, in my opinion, too inefficient.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?Or do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.I usually go full 90% in altcoins and 10 in stable. This varies but i haven't hodled too much Bitcoin for a long time. I am too scared of the potential POW based pairs ban in CEXes.Eth and Matic are good things to hodl for anyone like me who is constantly buying and selling nfts anyway.My biggest bag is a low cap crypto and i am hoping that will be my black horse and ticket out of powerty. And i have some tiny amounts in microcaps waiting if they blow up.

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?Or do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.Yes i focuse only on bitcoin and a few ehtereum just for fees, but i have a bitxoin stashed alrady even though it may not be much, but at least the amount is way above a few thousands of dollar.Portfolio control is very imoosrtant and from the loook of thing, an investor will see the long term advantage of Bitcoin and the short term of disadvantages or dealing.

comments.author: wxa7115
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?Or do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.The conformation of an investment portfolio depends on your goals, the risk you are willing to take and the asset classes in which you want to invest.Having most of your capital available to the cryptocurrency asset class invested on bitcoin and ethereum is a good idea as not only they perform well when a bull run appears, the risk they will crash as Luna and FTT did is low and this makes them a very good option for long term investing, right now both bitcoin and ethereum form the majority of my investment in this market, with small coins representing probably less than 1% of my capital.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: My portfolio is highly made of 80%, 2% Ethereum and the remaining 18% goes to top altcoins. I would have loved to have my portfolio filled more with Ethereum but the transaction cost is giving me hard time doing so. I just wish something is to be done about it soon. Ethereum is one of the coins I have been hodling for a long before it gets to her ATH last year. Will still be hodling it until she launches her V2. Maybe by then, I will have my portfolio filled up with it(30%) at least

comments.author: Dr.Osh
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?Or do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.the real goal in my portfolio is to hold ethereum in a bigger presentation than bitcoin, and other altcoins.Personally, I also invest 60% in ethereum, 30% in bitcoin and the rest in altcoins. in building a portfolio, I focus on that goal. however, under certain conditions, I sometimes change that to 70% for ethereum and the rest for bitcoin. although I know bitcoin much better than ethereum, yet I feel I am better suited to hold ethereum than bitcoin. so, in short my portfolio is likeEthereum = 60% / 70%Bitcoins = 30%Altcoin =10%I still use this pattern today

comments.author: samcrypto
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?Or do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.My portfolio is well diversified, at least 30% with Bitcoin and the rest are divided with the altcoins that I choose.You have to analyze the risk of getting to much exposure in a one coin, I just recently changed the percentage of my holdings in line with my own analysis. Never go all in, I can say that having a 80% exposure into a one coin only is already a risky decision, better to analyze again and look for alternatives.

comments.author: zasad@
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 23, 2023, 03:46:59 AMTell me about your coin portfolio weight.Do you mainly invest assets in Bitcoin and Ethereum?Or do you usually invest your assets in Altcoin?I usually invest 70-80% of my assets in Ethereum.70-80% of the investment portfolio is bad for one coin. There are always risks of loss in case of SEC regulation or network centralization. ATOM, DOT, Kusama will be a good diversification of Ethereum.For long-term investment, it is better to buy coins that do not look like stocks and were not sold at the ICO.

comments.author: Xxmodded
comments.body: I don't agree with your investment way spent almost 70% in one coins, I know this your business but my investment way spent portfolio than three until five coins with ratio 20% until 30% each coins. Current my portfolio holding in Ethereum about 30%, Binance coin 30%, have little assets investing in Solana when price drop last month about 20% and left 20% I hold in Bitcoin.I don't spent bigger amount in one coin although with most potential like Ethereum, I think don't put your eggs in one bracket is smart thing when investing assets in cryptocurrency.
